page.title: 13RELIGION IN COPFORD
page.content: Since before the Doomsday Book was completed in 1086,the{Parish Church}of St.Michael and All Angels has been the religious centre for the people of Copford.In a will dated 1539 the church was described as{"the church of {our Lady of Copforde",}perhaps the original dedication. History cries out from its walls which contain flint stones,Roman tiles and Medieval bricks.The present building is{Norman}and has three original windows.The roof was built of stone and contained an upper chamber with outside access. An acclaimed feature is it 12th. century{wall paintings}brightening the roof,pillars and arches.Other items of interest include a basin of a 12th. century font in Purbeck marble,a 14th. century oak chest and two enormous oak posts supporting the bell turret.
